result.execSummary:
The defendant Haley M Hintz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department.  Huber if approved by jail administration. - Stayed

miscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.
Early discharge upon recommendation of the Agent and Expungement option of 15CF221.

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Engage and comply in any other counseling as recommended by the Agent.

If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

records.addlTxt:
3:30 p.m. Defendant Haley M Hintz in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement. 
15CM175:  43 days jail w/43 days credit - time served, Pay costs.
15CF221: I/S Sentence: 150 days jail w/huber - no credit - Stayed
18 mo Probation with Conditions stated on the record.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.
Defendant enters a plea of: No Contest
Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 15CM175 and 15CF221 Ct 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.  15CF221 Counts 2 & 3 are Dismissed and Read In.
ADA Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler concurs with joint agreement. 

BY THE COURT: *****PROBATION***
15CF221: Count 1: I/S Sentence: 150 days jail w/huber or electronic monitor, if eligible - no credit - Stayed
18 mo Probation
Conditions:
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.
Engage and comply in any other counseling as recommended by the Agent.
Pay costs.
No conditional jail.
Early discharge upon recommendation of the Agent and Expungement option of 15CF221.

15CM175:  43 days jail w/43 days credit - time served, Pay costs.

Appeal rights provided.

3:32 p.m. Defendant Haley M Hintz in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   
Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Arraignment:
  State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Haley M Hintz in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.

State recommends the bond 15CM175 $500 cash bond was ordered with conditions be applied to this case as well.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
